Questions.Question: Who said 'The truth will set you free'?
Questions.Explanation: This quote is attributed to Jesus in the Bible, specifically in the Gospel of John.

Questions.Question: Which philosopher said 'The only true wisdom is in knowing you know nothing'?
Questions.Explanation: Socrates, the ancient Greek philosopher, is credited with this famous quote.

Questions.Question: Who said 'The greatest enemy of knowledge is not ignorance, it is the illusion of knowledge'?
Questions.Explanation: This quote is from Stephen Hawking, the renowned physicist and cosmologist.

Questions.Question: Which author said 'The truth is rarely pure and never simple'?
Questions.Explanation: Oscar Wilde, the Irish writer and poet, is the author of this quote.

Questions.Question: Who said 'The truth is incontrovertible. Malice may attack it, ignorance may deride it, but in the end, there it is'?
Questions.Explanation: This quote is attributed to Winston Churchill, the British statesman and Prime Minister.

Questions.Question: Which philosopher said 'The measure of intelligence is the ability to change'?
Questions.Explanation: Albert Einstein, the renowned physicist, is credited with this quote.

Questions.Question: Who said 'The truth is like a lion; you don't have to defend it. Let it loose; it will defend itself'?
Questions.Explanation: This quote is attributed to Augustine of Hippo, an early Christian theologian and philosopher.
